summary: Offline Android app for daily vehicle tracking (water tank, JCB, HYDRO) and accounting with Material Design UI, dashboard, date-wise reports, and PDF/Excel export.
architectural_notes: Offline-first: all data stored locally on-device (no network dependency).
Material Design UI with animations; support light/dark theme.
Compute derived fields (total working hours, payments, daily totals, balance) automatically and consistently across UI and reports.
Provide export generation for PDF and Excel from local data.

existing_features.title: Create an offline-first local data layer that persists all app data on the client device (browser) and works without network access, including schema/versioning and safe read/write helpers for: Water Tank entries, JCB/HYDRO work logs, and Accounting transactions.
Implement Water Tank entry CRUD: create, list by selected date, edit, and delete entries with fields: date, time, category (Salt Water | Drinking Water), party name, driver name, and notes.

Implement JCB and HYDRO work log CRUD: create, list by selected date, edit, and delete logs with fields: date, vehicle type (JCB | HYDRO), driver name, start time, end time, hourly rate; automatically compute total working hours and total payment per log.

Implement Daily Accounting module CRUD to record cashflow transactions with: type (Paid/Expense | Received/Income), amount, person name, date, and notes; automatically compute totals for a selected date: total expenses, total income, and balance in hand (income - expenses).

Create a dashboard screen that summarizes “today” with animated cards showing: today’s income, today’s expenses, today’s balance in hand, total vehicle hours for today (JCB+HYDRO), and count of today’s Water Tank entries; cards should link to the relevant date-filtered views.

Add date-wise reports views for each module (Water Tank, Vehicle Work Logs, Accounting) with a shared date selector, allowing users to quickly switch days and see the filtered records plus computed totals where applicable.

Implement export for date-wise reports to PDF and Excel: user can export the currently selected date’s Water Tank entries, Vehicle logs (JCB/HYDRO), and Accounting transactions, including totals in the exported output.

Build a modern, clean, animated Material-inspired UI with a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) applied consistently across dashboard, forms, lists, and report views; do not use a blue/purple primary palette.
Add light/dark mode support with a user-facing toggle and persistence of the selected mode locally.
Add robust form validation and UX safeguards: required fields, numeric validation for amount/hourly rate, time validation (end after start), and confirm prompts for destructive deletes.
Provide simple in-app navigation to the main areas: Dashboard, Water Tank, Vehicle (JCB/HYDRO), Accounting, and Reports/Exports, optimized for mobile layouts.

new_feature_requests.summary: Water tank vehicle entry module (date/time, category salt/drinking, party, driver, notes) with date-wise list plus full edit/delete
JCB and HYDRO tracking module (date, driver, start/end time, hourly rate) with automatic total hours and payment calculation
Daily accounting module for amounts paid/received (person, date, notes) with automatic totals (expenses, income, balance in hand)
Dashboard with animated cards showing today’s income, expenses, balance, vehicle hours, and water tank entries
Local offline data storage with ability to edit anytime
Export reports/data to PDF or Excel
Modern animated Material Design UI with smooth professional UX and light/dark mode

projectName: Offline-first vehicle tracking + daily accounting app with dashboard, reports, and PDF/Excel export
